page.title: 11CHIPPERFIELD COMMON
page.content: One hundred or so Hertfordshire acres, Wicket and outfield included in these; Two mounds one hundred yards apart _ Did archers once flex muscles, and between them arrows speed? Silver birch, oak ash and cherry, Scots pine, beech, holly being cleared Sweet chestnuts brought by Crusaders? Bracken and cauliflower fungi towards autumn appear. Apostles' pond, old limes pollarded, Twelve new ones planted further out. Frogs, newts, waterboatmen breed here; Meadowbrown butterfly and common blue. Clumps of gorze and heather;foxgloves, Hairbell, bedstraw, and celandines hue Starlings row with green woodpeckers for holes in trees. Magpies rob nests of eggs and fledglings too. Chiff _ chaff, blue tit and wren busy our common through.
